query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 O voi che siete in piccioletta barca, 2 desiderosi d’ascoltar, seguiti 3 dietro al mio legno che cantando varca,
4 tornate a riveder li vostri liti: 5 non vi mettete in pelago, ché forse, 6 perdendo me, rimarreste smarriti.
query.result:
**English:**
1 O you who are in a tiny boat, 2 desiring to listen, follow 3 behind my ship that sails singing,
4 turn back to see your shores again: 5 do not put out into the deep sea, for perhaps, 6 losing me, you would remain lost.
**Sanskrit:**
1 He bhavantas tiryagbhāve vartate, 2 śrotum icchanti, anugacchata, 3 mama nauḥ gāyanīm anveti,
4 punar āgacchata svakīyān tīrān paśyātha: 5 gambhīre samudre mā praviśata, kim tu, 6 mamaṃ naṣṭvā, bhraṣṭāḥ syuḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 L’acqua ch’io prendo già mai non si corse; 8 Minerva spira, e conducemi Appollo, 9 e nove Muse mi dimostran l’Orse.
query.result:
**English:**
7 The water that I take has never been sailed before; 8 Minerva breathes, and Apollo guides me, 9 and the nine Muses show me the Great Bear.
**Sanskrit:**
7 Jalam yat aham gṛhṇāmi na kadācit purastāt plavitam āsīt; 8 Mīnarvā anilaḥ, ca Apallaḥ māṃ nayati, 9 nava ca Mūṣāḥ ṛkṣaṃ mahat mahyaṃ darśayanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Voialtri pochi che drizzaste il collo 11 per tempo al pan de li angeli, del quale 12 vivesi qui ma non sen vien satollo,
13 metter potete ben per l’alto sale 14 vostro navigio, servando mio solco 15 dinanzi a l’acqua che ritorna equale.
query.result:
**English:**
10 You few who have raised your heads 11 in time to the bread of the angels, of which 12 one lives here but never becomes sated,
13 you can set your ship on the high seas, 14 following my furrow 15 before the water returns to being equal.
**Sanskrit:**
10 Yuṣmākaṃ alpāḥ ye udvṛttaṃ śiraḥ 11 kālena amṛtasya āhārasya, yena 12 jīvati atra api na sampūrṇataḥ trptaḥ bhavati,
13 sthāpayitum śaknutha eva uttamaṃ mārgaṃ 14 yuṣmākaṃ naukā, anugacchataḥ mama śīrṣaṇḍakam 15 pūrvam tasya jalasya yat samaṃ punar bhavati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 Que’ glorïosi che passaro al Colco 17 non s’ammiraron come voi farete, 18 quando Iasón vider fatto bifolco.
query.result:
**English:**
16 Those glorious ones who sailed to Colchis 17 did not marvel as you will do, 18 when they saw Jason become a plowman.
**Sanskrit:**
16 Te yaśasvinaḥ ye Kolkaṃ jagmuḥ 17 na vismayam āpuḥ yathā yūyam kariṣyatha, 18 yadā Yāsonaṃ kṛṣikam adṛkṣanta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 La concreata e perpetüa sete 20 del deïforme regno cen portava 21 veloci quasi come ’l ciel vedete.
query.result:
**English:**
19 The innate and perpetual thirst 20 of the misshapen realm was carrying us 21 swiftly, as you see the heavens.
**Sanskrit:**
19 Saṃbhavaḥ ca nityaś ca tṛṣṇā 20 Vikṛta-rūpa-rājyasya ānayati sma naḥ 21 Tīvra-vegaḥ yathā divyam jagat paśyatha.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Beatrice in suso, e io in lei guardava; 23 e forse in tanto in quanto un quadrel posa 24 e vola e da la noce si dischiava,
25 giunto mi vidi ove mirabil cosa 26 mi torse il viso a sé; e però quella 27 cui non potea mia cura essere ascosa,
28 volta ver’ me, sì lieta come bella, 29 «Drizza la mente in Dio grata», mi disse, 30 «che n’ha congiunti con la prima stella».
query.result:
**English:**
22 Beatrice was above, and I gazed up at her; 23 and perhaps in the time that an arrow takes 24 to fly and leave the bowstring,
25 I found myself where a marvelous thing 26 turned my face toward it; and therefore she 27 to whom my desire could not be hidden,
28 turned to me, as joyful as she was beautiful, 29 and said, "Direct your mind gratefully to God, 30 who has brought us together with the first star."
**Sanskrit:**
22 Beatrice upari āsīt, aham ca tasyāṃ dṛṣṭim nyavedayam, 23 ca api yāvad ekaḥ śaraḥ kṣiptaḥ syāt 24 tataś ca uḍḍīya niśāyāḥ parimucyeta,
25 tatra āgato 'haṃ adarśam yatra adbhutaṃ vastu 26 mama vaktram tasya abhimukham cakāra; tasmāt sā 27 yasyāṃ mama abhilāṣaḥ na gūḍhaḥ abhavat,
28 mama abhimukham āvartata, tathā prasannā yathā sundarī, 29 "Manaḥ tava parameśvare prasādayitum niyojaya", mama abravīt, 30 "yaḥ asmān prathamena nakṣatreṇa sametayati."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 Parev’ a me che nube ne coprisse 32 lucida, spessa, solida e pulita, 33 quasi adamante che lo sol ferisse.
query.result:
**English:**
31 It seemed to me that a cloud was covering me, 32 bright, dense, solid, and polished, 33 like a diamond that the sun was striking.
**Sanskrit:**
31 Pareva me yaḥ abhraḥ ācchādayati sma mām, 32 Prakāśaḥ, sthūlaḥ, dṛḍhaḥ, nirmalaḥ ca, 33 Yathā vajraḥ yaḥ sūryam abhighātayati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 Per entro sé l’etterna margarita 35 ne ricevette, com’ acqua recepe 36 raggio di luce permanendo unita.
query.result:
**English:**
34 Within itself the eternal pearl 35 received them, like water receives 36 a ray of light, remaining united.
**Sanskrit:**
34 Antaḥ svayam nityā muktā 35 Pratyakṣīkaroti, yathā jalam gṛhṇāti 36 Prakāśakiraṇam ekatvam āpannam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 S’io era corpo, e qui non si concepe 38 com’ una dimensione altra patio, 39 ch’esser convien se corpo in corpo repe,
40 accender ne dovria più il disio 41 di veder quella essenza in che si vede 42 come nostra natura e Dio s’unio.
query.result:
**English:**
37 If I was a body, and here it is not conceived 38 how another dimension could fit, 39 which must be if body repeats itself in body,
40 it should kindle in us a greater desire 41 to see that essence in which it is seen 42 how our nature and God were united.
**Sanskrit:**
37 Yadi aham śarīram āsam, atra ca na pratipadyate 38 katham anyā vimānaḥ samāveśayet, 39 yaḥ sambhāvayitavyaḥ yadi śarīram śarīre punaḥ punaḥ āvartate,
40 tad adhikam asmāsu icchām janayet 41 tām tattvam draṣṭum yasmin dṛśyate 42 katham asmākam prakṛtiḥ ca Bhagavān ca aikībhūtāv abhavatām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 Lì si vedrà ciò che tenem per fede, 44 non dimostrato, ma fia per sé noto 45 a guisa del ver primo che l’uom crede.
query.result:
**English:**
43 There one will see what we hold by faith, 44 not demonstrated, but will be known in itself, 45 like the first truth that man believes.
**Sanskrit:**
43 Tatrāvalokyate yad viśvasādhīnam, 44 anapekṣam, svataḥ prakāśam, 45 yathā prathamam tattvam manuṣyeṇa viśvasyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 Io rispuosi: «Madonna, sì devoto 47 com’ esser posso più, ringrazio lui 48 lo qual dal mortal mondo m’ha remoto.
query.result:
**English:**
46 I answered: "My Lady, as devoutly 47 as I can be, I thank him 48 who has removed me from the mortal world.
**Sanskrit:**
46 Aham uvāca: "Bhagavatī, yathā bhaktimān 47 bhavitum śaknomi, tathaiva tasmai kṛtajñaḥ asmi 48 yaḥ mā martyalokāt apahṛtaḥ asti."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Ma ditemi: che son li segni bui 50 di questo corpo, che là giuso in terra 51 fan di Cain favoleggiare altrui?».
query.result:
**English:**
49 But tell me: what are the evil signs 50 of this body, which down there on earth 51 make people gossip about Cain?
**Sanskrit:**
49 Kim punar ayam śarīrasya durliṅgaḥ, 50 Yaḥ adhastāt pṛthivyām, 51 Yena anye Kainaṃ kathāpayanti?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Ella sorrise alquanto, e poi «S’elli erra 53 l’oppinïon», mi disse, «d’i mortali 54 dove chiave di senso non diserra,
55 certo non ti dovrien punger li strali 56 d’ammirazione omai, poi dietro ai sensi 57 vedi che la ragione ha corte l’ali.
query.result:
**English:**
52 She smiled a little, and then said to me, "If the opinion of mortals errs, 53 where the key of understanding does not unlock, 54 certainly the arrows of amazement should no longer pierce you, 55 since you see that reason has clipped its wings behind the senses.
**Sanskrit:**
52 Sā kincid hasitvā, tataḥ "yadi khalu bhramayati 53 martyānām abhiprayaḥ," iti mama uvāca, "yatra jñānasya kuñcikā na vivṛṇoti, 54 na khalu tvām iṣavaḥ vismayasya vidhyuḥ, 55 yataḥ paśyasi yad yuktir indriyāṇām paścād valayati pakṣau.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Ma dimmi quel che tu da te ne pensi». 59 E io: «Ciò che n’appar qua sù diverso 60 credo che fanno i corpi rari e densi».
query.result:
**English:**
58 But tell me what you think about it yourself." 59 And I: "What appears different to us up here, 60 I believe is caused by the bodies being rare and dense."
**Sanskrit:**
58 Api tu mama bruhi yattvam matvāsi. 59 Aham ca: "Yat kiñcid atra viśeṣeṇa dṛśyate, 60 tat śarīrāṇāṃ ravatvāt sthūlatvād vā manye."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Ed ella: «Certo assai vedrai sommerso 62 nel falso il creder tuo, se bene ascolti 63 l’argomentar ch’io li farò avverso.
query.result:
**English:**
61 And she: "You will certainly see your belief 62 submerged in falsehood, if you listen well 63 to the argument that I will make against it.
**Sanskrit:**
61 Tathā ca sā: "Niścitam atiśayam drakṣyasi nimajjitam 62 mithyātvāt tava viśvāsam, yadi śuśrūṣase samyak 63 yuktim yām aham kariṣyāmi tasya viparītām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 La spera ottava vi dimostra molti 65 lumi, li quali e nel quale e nel quanto 66 notar si posson di diversi volti.
query.result:
**English:**
64 The eighth sphere shows you many 65 lights, which can be noted in their quality and quantity 66 with different aspects.
**Sanskrit:**
64 Aṣṭamam vyoman darśayati te bahūn 65 dīpān, ye ca ke ca ke ca prakāreṇa prakāreṇa 66 jñātum śakyante vividhair rūpaiḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Se raro e denso ciò facesser tanto, 68 una sola virtù sarebbe in tutti, 69 più e men distributa e altrettanto.
query.result:
**English:**
67 If the rare and the dense cause this much, 68 then there would be only one virtue in all, 69 distributed more or less, but equally.
**Sanskrit:**
67 Yadi alpam ca sthūlam ca etad eva kurutaḥ, 68 tadā sarveṣu eka eva guṇaḥ syāt, 69 adhika-alpaka-vibhāgena samaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Virtù diverse esser convegnon frutti 71 di princìpi formali, e quei, for ch’uno, 72 seguiterieno a tua ragion distrutti.
query.result:
**English:**
70 Diverse virtues must be the fruits 71 of formal principles, and those, because of one, 72 would follow, destroyed by your reasoning.
**Sanskrit:**
70 Nānāvidhāḥ śaktayaḥ phalāni bhavanti 71 rūpātmakānāṃ tattvānām, tāśca, ekasya, 72 vināśe tava yuktyā vināśam āpadyeran.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Ancor, se raro fosse di quel bruno 74 cagion che tu dimandi, o d’oltre in parte 75 fora di sua materia sì digiuno
76 esto pianeto, o, sì come comparte 77 lo grasso e ’l magro un corpo, così questo 78 nel suo volume cangerebbe carte.
query.result:
**English:**
73 Even if the cause of that darkness you ask about were rare, 74 or came from elsewhere, 75 this planet would be so devoid of its matter,
76 or, just as a body distributes fat and muscle, 77 so too this planet would change pages in its volume.
**Sanskrit:**
73 Api cet, yadi viram asya kṛṣṇasya 74 kāraṇaṃ yac chipraṣṭaṃ tvayā, vā anyatra bhāvet, 75 ayam grahaḥ svaviṣayāt tathā vihīnaḥ syāt,
76 vā yathā śarīraṃ medas-māṃsādikam vibhajate, 77 evam ayam api svayamāne patram anyat vikurvīta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Se ’l primo fosse, fora manifesto 80 ne l’eclissi del sol, per trasparere 81 lo lume come in altro raro ingesto.
query.result:
**English:**
79 If the first [body] were [the cause], it would be evident 80 in the eclipse of the sun, for the light would shine through, 81 as in another rare medium.
**Sanskrit:**
79 Yadi prathamaḥ syāt, tadā spaṣṭaṃ syāt 80 sūryagrahaṇe, prakāśasya paratra virodhena prakāśamānatvāt, 81 yathā anyasmim virodhe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 Questo non è: però è da vedere 83 de l’altro; e s’elli avvien ch’io l’altro cassi, 84 falsificato fia lo tuo parere.
query.result:
**English:**
82 This is not: but it is to be seen 83 of the other; and if it happens that I break the other, 84 your opinion will be falsified.
**Sanskrit:**
82 Etad eva na asti: tat tu draṣṭavyam 83 anyad api; yadi vā tad api bhinomi, 84 tadā tava matam mithyā syāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 Or dirai tu ch’el si dimostra tetro 92 ivi lo raggio più che in altre parti, 93 per esser lì refratto più a retro.
query.result:
**English:**
91 Now you will say that the ray of light 92 shows itself there more than in other parts, 93 because it is refracted there more backward.
**Sanskrit:**
91 Atha vā tvam vakṣyasi yatra tatra 92 raśmirapi anyatrapekṣayā adhikaṃ prakāśate, 93 tatraiva tadanantaraṃ adhikaṃ pratibaddhaḥ asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 Da questa instanza può deliberarti 95 esperïenza, se già mai la provi, 96 ch’esser suol fonte ai rivi di vostr’ arti.
query.result:
**English:**
94 From this perplexity experience can free you, 95 if ever you try it, 96 which is usually the source of the streams of your arts.
**Sanskrit:**
94 Asmāt saṃśayāt tvāṃ vimokṣayitum śaknoti 95 Anubhavaḥ, yadi kadācit tam anubhavasi, 96 Yaḥ evaṃ bhavaty udbhavaḥ vo yuṣmat-kalānām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Tre specchi prenderai; e i due rimovi 98 da te d’un modo, e l’altro, più rimosso, 99 tr’ambo li primi li occhi tuoi ritrovi.
query.result:
**English:**
97 You will take three mirrors; and remove the two 98 from you in one way, and the other, more distant, 99 between the first two your eyes will find.
**Sanskrit:**
97 Trayaḥ darpaṇāḥ gṛhṇīṣva; ubhau ca 98 tvayā ekena prakāreṇa apakramaṇīyau, anyaḥ ca, dūrataḥ sthitaḥ, 99 ubhayor api pūrvaयोḥ madhye tava netrāṇi prāpsyanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 Rivolto ad essi, fa che dopo il dosso 101 ti stea un lume che i tre specchi accenda 102 e torni a te da tutti ripercosso.
query.result:
**English:**
100 Turn to them, and make that after the hill 101 a light may stand for you, which may kindle 102 the three mirrors, and may be reflected back to you from all.
**Sanskrit:**
100 Teṣāṃ prati mukhaṃ kṛtvā kuru yathā parvatāt paścāt 101 Tejas te astu prakāśakam yat trayāṇi darpaṇāni prakāśayet 102 Sarvataḥ ca tava pratibimbitaṃ bhavet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Ben che nel quanto tanto non si stenda 104 la vista più lontana, lì vedrai 105 come convien ch’igualmente risplenda.
query.result:
**English:**
103 Although the sight does not extend 104 farther in the distance, there you will see 105 how it is fitting that it shine equally.
**Sanskrit:**
103 Yadyapi yāvad dūre dṛṣṭiḥ na vistarati, 104 tatra tvam drakṣyasi, 105 katham ucitam asti yathā samānaṃ prakāśate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Or, come ai colpi de li caldi rai 107 de la neve riman nudo il suggetto 108 e dal colore e dal freddo primai,
109 così rimaso te ne l’intelletto 110 voglio informar di luce sì vivace, 111 che ti tremolerà nel suo aspetto.
query.result:
**English:**
106 Now, just as under the blows of the hot rays 107 of the sun the subject remains stripped 108 of both color and cold,
109 so have you remained in your intellect. 110 I want to inform you with such a vivid light 111 that it will make you tremble at its appearance.
**Sanskrit:**
106 Atha yathā gharmaraśmibhiḥ 107 Himaḥ vinirjitaḥ prakṛtiṃ parityajati 108 Varṇataḥ śītatāyāś ca pūrvam,
109 Tathā tvayi buddhau sthite 110 Tām prakāśayitum icchāmi jyotir evaṃ prakāśam 111 Yena tvam tasya darśanāt kampasi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Dentro dal ciel de la divina pace 113 si gira un corpo ne la cui virtute 114 l’esser di tutto suo contento giace.
query.result:
**English:**
112 Within the heaven of divine peace 113 revolves a body in whose virtue 114 the essence of all its contentment lies.
**Sanskrit:**
112 Antaḥ divyasya śānti-ākāśasya 113 Paribhramati ekaḥ śarīraḥ yasya śaktau 114 Sarvasya tasya tuṣṭeḥ sattvam vartate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Lo ciel seguente, c’ha tante vedute, 116 quell’ esser parte per diverse essenze, 117 da lui distratte e da lui contenute.
query.result:
**English:**
115 The following heaven, which has so many stars, 116 that being is divided into diverse essences, 117 separated from it and contained by it.
**Sanskrit:**
115 Anantaraṃ svargaḥ, yasya tārakāḥ santi anekaśaḥ, 116 tat sattvaṃ vibhaktam anekaśaḥ sattvaiḥ, 117 tena vibhinnaiḥ tena ca samāveśitaiḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Li altri giron per varie differenze 119 le distinzion che dentro da sé hanno 120 dispongono a lor fini e lor semenze.
query.result:
**English:**
118 The other circles, through various differences, 119 the distinctions which they have within themselves, 120 dispose their ends and their seeds.
**Sanskrit:**
118 Apare ca parimaṇḍalāni nānāprakārairviseṣaiḥ 119 Antarniviṣṭaiḥ svabhāvairvibhinnāni 120 Svakīyāṃ niyatim svakīyāṃ ca jātiṃ niyuñjate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 Questi organi del mondo così vanno, 122 come tu vedi omai, di grado in grado, 123 che di sù prendono e di sotto fanno.
query.result:
**English:**
121 These organs of the world proceed in this way, 122 as you can now see, from grade to grade, 123 that from above they take and from below they make.
**Sanskrit:**
121 Etāni lokendriyāṇi tathā pravartante, 122 Yathā tvam adhunā paśyasi kramāt kramāt, 123 Yata ūrddhvam gṛhṇanti tata ādhastāt kurvanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Riguarda bene omai sì com’ io vado 125 per questo loco al vero che disiri, 126 sì che poi sappi sol tener lo guado.
query.result:
**English:**
124 Now look carefully at how I go 125 through this place to the truth that you desire, 126 so that later you may know how to keep to the ford alone.
**Sanskrit:**
124 Idānīm paśya yathāham gacchāmi 125 Asmin sthāne satyātmakaṃ yat tvam icchasi, 126 Yathā paścāt tvam eva jānīṣe setum dhārayitum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 E come l’alma dentro a vostra polve 134 per differenti membra e conformate 135 a diverse potenze si risolve,
136 così l’intelligenza sua bontate 137 multiplicata per le stelle spiega, 138 girando sé sovra sua unitate.
query.result:
**English:**
133 And just as the soul within your body 134 through different and conforming members 135 resolves itself into diverse faculties,
136 so its intelligence, its goodness 137 multiplied through the stars it unfolds, 138 revolving itself upon its own unity.
**Sanskrit:**
133 Evaṃ yathātmā yuṣmaddehe 134 Viśeṣaiḥ sarvaiḥ saṅgatya 135 Vibhinneṣu śaktibhiḥ saṃsthitā,
136 Tathā tasya jñānam śubham ca 137 Naksatreṣu vividheṣu vistīrṇam 138 Parivartate svātmani sthitam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 Virtù diversa fa diversa lega 140 col prezïoso corpo ch’ella avviva, 141 nel qual, sì come vita in voi, si lega.
query.result:
**English:**
139 Diverse virtue makes a diverse bond 140 with the precious body that it enlivens, 141 in which, just as life in you, it is bound.
**Sanskrit:**
139 Virtūḥ viśiṣṭā karoti viśiṣṭaṃ sambandham 140 sahitam mūlyena śarīreṇa yat sā jīvayati, 141 yasmin, yathā jīvitaṃ yūṣmatsu, sā sambandhyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
142 Per la natura lieta onde deriva, 143 la virtù mista per lo corpo luce 144 come letizia per pupilla viva.
query.result:
**English:**
142 Through the joyful nature from which it is derived, 143 virtue, mingled with the body, shines 144 like joy through a living pupil.
**Sanskrit:**
142 Prakṛter ānandamayāt prabhavati yataḥ, 143 śarīreṇa miśritā guṇaḥ prakāśate 144 yathā jīvanti śiṣye pramodaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
145 Da essa vien ciò che da luce a luce 146 par differente, non da denso e raro; 147 essa è formal principio che produce,
148 conforme a sua bontà, lo turbo e ’l chiaro».
query.result:
**English:**
145 From it comes that which gives light to light, 146 differing only in density and rarity; 147 it is the formal principle that produces,
148 according to its goodness, the murky and the clear."
**Sanskrit:**
145 Tasyā eva prakāśāt prakāśaḥ sambhavati 146 Bhinnaḥ sthūlatvāt sūkṣmatvāt ca, 147 Sā eva rūpa-tattvaṃ kāraṇam utpadyate,
148 Svasya śubhatayā tamaḥ prakāśaś ca.
